db:abstract.db:para: Provides a way to have a synchronous function executed each frame.
This type was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The FrameAction provides a way to perform tasks each frame in a synchronized way with the Qt3D backend. This is useful to implement some aspects of application logic and to prototype functionality that can later be folded into an additional Qt3D aspect.
For example, the FrameAction can be used to animate a property in sync with the Qt3D engine where a Qt Quick animation element is not perfectly synchronized and may lead to stutters in some cases.
To execute your own code each frame connect to the FrameAction::triggered signal.

db:section.db:title: triggered(real dt)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted each frame.
